name: Pylon.DB.Filter

aliases.name: Document
aliases.comment: Represents the getters for a document type used by a filter.
aliases.type: { ref : doctype -> String , fields : List ( doctype -> String, Float ) }

types.name: FilterFeedback
types.comment:
FilterFeedback for a filter containing results. These will be matched to the current state by
sequence number, so old search results will not overwrite a newer query.

values.name: filter
values.comment: Create a new filter from a document description.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Filter.Document doctype -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype

values.name: filterAsync
values.comment: Filter asynchronously. When executed, the resulting task will send update(s) to the provided filter feedback address.
values.type: Signal.Address (List (Pylon.DB.Filter.FilterFeedback doctype)) -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype -> ( Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype , List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )

values.name: filterAsyncAs
values.comment: Filter asynchronously with a forwarding address.
values.type: (List (Pylon.DB.Filter.FilterFeedback doctype) -> List action) -> Signal.Address (List action) -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype -> ( Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype , List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )

values.name: filterInputOne
values.comment:
Handle a filter result. This may update the latest field to reflect the latest results
continuously, even if the sequence numbers do not match. If they do, the existing filter will be
entirely replaced by the result one since the index cannot have changed since then.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Filter.FilterFeedback doctype -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype

values.name: filterMirror
values.comment: Synchronize the document store with the contents of a DB group.
values.type: (String -> rectype -> doctype) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data rectype) -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype

values.name: filterMirror'
values.comment: Synchronize the document store with the contents of a mirror.
values.type: (String -> rectype -> doctype) -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror rectype -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype

values.name: filterQuery
values.comment: Set a new query string.
values.type: String -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype

values.name: filterQueryIf
values.comment: Set a new query conditionally.
values.type: (String -> Bool) -> String -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype

values.name: filterSync
values.comment: Filter synchronously. The results are immediately available in the resulting Filter.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype -> Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype

values.name: getFilterQuery
values.comment: Get the latest filter query.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype -> String

values.name: getFilterResults
values.comment: Get the current filter results.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype -> Pylon.Resource.Resource String (List ( doctype, Float ))

values.name: getLastFilterResults
values.comment: Get the latest filter results.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Filter.Filter doctype -> Maybe.Maybe (List ( doctype, Float ))

name: Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group
comment:
This is being kept in a seperate legacy module where it will not clutter things. Since a lot
of code is based on it for now, it is being kept intact. Do not use this module if you are not already
heavily invested in an existing project that uses these.

@docs bindingGroupTo, dataRebasedBinding, dataSubBinding, forwardingGroupTo, groupDataSubscriber, groupRebasedBinding, groupRebasedDataSubscriber, groupSubBinding, groupSubscriber, orderGroupBy, sendingGroupTo

values.name: bindingGroupTo
values.comment:
DEPRECIATED, removed in 6.0.0

Construct a new incomplete group binding from a ElmFire Firebase location.
values.type: ElmFire.Location -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding subfeedback

values.name: dataRebasedBinding
values.comment:
DEPRECIATED, removed in 6.0.0

Rebased binding uses the key of the discovered item to get a child at a diffeent location than
that of the group binding. A good example would be a subscription that tracks a group of users,
but actually pulls data from a global profiles list.
values.type: ElmFire.Location -> Pylon.DB.Config v -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding (Pylon.DB.Feedback v) -> String -> Pylon.DB.Binding v

values.name: dataSubBinding
values.comment:
DEPRECIATED, removed in 6.0.0

A convenience function which makes it a little bit easier to declare a sub-binding function for
concrete data. Note that if you are using the `groupDataSubscriber` convenience function, then this
is already invoked internally, making the task of bindin a group of concrete records even easier.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Config v -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding (Pylon.DB.Feedback v) -> String -> Pylon.DB.Binding v

values.name: forwardingGroupTo
values.comment:
DEPRECIATED, removed in 6.0.0

Provide an address for group feedback actions with a transformation function for forwarding. If
this is not applied to the binding, no feedback will be recieved.
values.type: (List (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback) -> List action) -> Signal.Address (List action) -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding subfeedback -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding subfeedback

values.name: groupDataSubscriber
values.comment:
DEPRECIATED, removed in 6.0.0

Convenience function that makes it easier to bind a `Group (DB.Data v)`.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Config v -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding (Pylon.DB.Feedback v) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) , List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: groupRebasedBinding
values.comment:
DEPRECIATED, removed in 6.0.0

Rebased binding for nested groups.
values.type: ElmFire.Location -> ElmFire.OrderOptions -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback') -> String -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding subfeedback'

values.name: groupRebasedDataSubscriber
values.comment:
DEPRECIATED, removed in 6.0.0

Convenience function that makes it easier to bind a `Group (DB.Data v)`.
values.type: ElmFire.Location -> Pylon.DB.Config v -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding (Pylon.DB.Feedback v) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) , List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: groupSubBinding
values.comment:
DEPRECIATED, removed in 6.0.0

A convenience function which makes it a little bit easier to declare a sub-binding function for
nested groups.
values.type: ElmFire.OrderOptions -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback') -> String -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding subfeedback'

values.name: groupSubscriber
values.comment:
DEPRECIATED, removed in 6.0.0

This is the old subscription primitive, and is quite a bit more limited. For testing purposes,
it has been implemented in terms of `groupIntegrate` and `groupSubscription`. `groupIntegrate` is
much more powerful, and takes a list of "sourcing" functions like `groupSubscription`.
values.type: (subtype -> ( subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )) -> (subbinding -> subtype -> ( subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )) -> (Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding subfeedback -> String -> subbinding) -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding subfeedback -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: orderGroupBy
values.comment:
DEPRECIATED, removed in 6.0.0

Give an ordering for the group subscription's internal query. Note that this _will not order the
resulting key-value dictionary_, but it is still useful because it will have an effect on which
results are produced by the Firebase API in the event that limiting is used, which is the case for
most practical applications.
values.type: ElmFire.OrderOptions -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding subfeedback -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding subfeedback

values.name: sendingGroupTo
values.comment:
DEPRECIATED, removed in 6.0.0

Provide an address for group feedback actions. If this is not applied to the binding, no feedback
will be recieved.
values.type: Signal.Address (List (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback)) -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding subfeedback -> Pylon.DB.Legacy.Group.GroupBinding subfeedback

name: Pylon.DB.Mirror

values.name: attach
values.comment: Mirror a DB group. Depreciated alias for attachDelta.
values.type: (String -> rectype -> doctype) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data rectype) -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype

values.name: attachDelta
values.comment: Apply the currently pending set of group deltas to a mirror.
values.type: (String -> rectype -> doctype) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data rectype) -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype

values.name: attachFilterDelta
values.comment: Apply the currently pending set of group deltas to a mirror, excluding any key-record pairs that produce Nothing instead of Just a document.
values.type: (String -> rectype -> Maybe.Maybe doctype) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data rectype) -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype

values.name: attachFilterSynch
values.comment: Reflect the entire group working set in a mirror, excluding any key-record pairs that produce Nothing instead of Just a document.
values.type: (String -> rectype -> Maybe.Maybe doctype) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data rectype) -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype

values.name: attachSynch
values.comment: Reflect the entire group working set in a mirror.
values.type: (String -> rectype -> doctype) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data rectype) -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype

values.name: bindMirror
values.comment:
Mirror output binding function for use with GroupConfig

    config =
      { address = myAddress
      , binding = bindMirror routeByDoc myMirror
      }
values.type: (String -> doctype -> subbinding) -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Signal.Address (List (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback)) -> String -> subbinding

values.name: changedRefs
values.comment: Get the pending reference dictionary.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Dict.Dict String doctype

values.name: commit
values.comment: Accept the current changes.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype

values.name: dataGroupMirror
values.type: Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Group.GroupConfig (Pylon.DB.Feedback v) (Pylon.DB.Binding v) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) , List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: dataGroupMirrorSynch
values.type: Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Group.GroupConfig (Pylon.DB.Feedback v) (Pylon.DB.Binding v) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) , List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: deltas
values.comment: Get the deltas used to change the reference dictionary.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Dict.Dict String (List ( Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError doctype , Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError doctype ))

values.name: forward
values.comment: Forward deltas from one mirror to another.
values.type: (String -> doctype -> doctype') -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype' -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype'

values.name: groupMirror
values.comment: Use this in place of groupSubscription to synchronize the group's keys to a mirror.
values.type: subtype -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Group.GroupConfig subfeedback subbinding -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: groupMirrorSynch
values.comment: Use this in place of groupSubscription to synchronize the group's keys to a mirror.
values.type: subtype -> (subtype -> ( subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )) -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Group.GroupConfig subfeedback subbinding -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: inject
values.comment:
Inject a change. This can be used to manually control mirror sources in the case that they
are not derived from some DB.Group.
values.type: String -> Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError doctype -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype

values.name: mirror
values.comment: Create a new mirror from a document description.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype

values.name: refresh
values.comment: Forcibly refresh the mirrored data for a particular key.
values.type: List String -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype

values.name: refs
values.comment: Get the current reference dictionary.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Mirror.Mirror doctype -> Dict.Dict String doctype

name: Pylon.DB.Meta

aliases.name: MetaData
aliases.type: { timeStampOffset : Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError Time.Time , isConnected : Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError Bool , authentication : Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError ElmFire.Auth.Authentication , subscriptions : Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaSubscriptions }

types.name: MetaFeedback
types.comment: Feedback for the the server metadata subscription.

values.name: getAuthenticationStatus
values.comment: Get the resource representing the current authentication status to the server.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaData -> Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError ElmFire.Auth.Authentication

values.name: getConnectionStatus
values.comment: Get the resource representing the current connection status to the server.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaData -> Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError Bool

values.name: getTimestampOffset
values.comment: Get the resource representing the current timestamp offset to the server.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaData -> Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError Time.Time

values.name: metaBindingTo
values.comment: Create a metadata binding for a firebase location. Should be the root location.
values.type: ElmFire.Location -> Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaBinding

values.name: metaForwardingTo
values.comment: Add an address to a metadata binding with a forwarding function.
values.type: (List Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaFeedback -> List action) -> Signal.Address (List action) -> Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaBinding -> Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaBinding

values.name: metaInput
values.comment: Server metadata list update function.
values.type: List Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaFeedback -> Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaData -> Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaData

values.name: metaInputOne
values.comment: Server metadata single update function.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaFeedback -> Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaData -> Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaData

values.name: metaSendingTo
values.comment:
Add an address to a metadata binding. Unless you do this, feedback will go to a hidden internal
drain.
values.type: Signal.Address (List Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaFeedback) -> Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaBinding -> Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaBinding

values.name: metaSubscribe
values.comment: Subscribe to the server metadata at your root Firebase location.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaBinding -> Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaData -> ( Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaData, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: nilMetaData
values.comment: Empty metadata record. A metadata record should always be initialized to this.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Meta.MetaData

values.name: serverTimestampPlaceholder
values.comment: A placeholder for encoding the server timestamp.
values.type: Json.Encode.Value

name: Pylon.DB.Group

aliases.name: Group
aliases.type: { dataDelta : Dict.Dict String ( subtype, Pylon.DB.Group.GroupDelta ) , data : Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError (Dict.Dict String subtype) , addSubscription : Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError ElmFire.Subscription , removeSubscription : Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError ElmFire.Subscription , currentLocation : Maybe.Maybe ElmFire.Location }

aliases.name: GroupConfig
aliases.comment: Specifies the binding behavior and mailbox address for a groupIntegrate
aliases.type: { binding : Signal.Address (List (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback)) -> String -> subbinding , address : Signal.Address (List (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback)) }

values.name: cancelAndResetDataGroup
values.comment:
Convenience function for cancelling and resetting a `Group (DB.Data v)` at once, such that the next
time a `group*Subscriber` is reached, it will be immediately rebound.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) , List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: cancelAndResetGroup
values.comment:
Convenience function for cancelling and resetting a group at once, such that the next time
a `group*Subscriber` is reached, it will be immediately rebound.
values.type: (subtype -> ( subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: cancelDataGroup
values.comment: Convenience function for cancelling a `Group (DB.Data v)`.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) , List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: cancelGroup
values.comment:
Cancel a `Group`'s active subscription if any, resulting in a `Group` that is not effected by
subscriptions until a call to `groupReset`.
values.type: (subtype -> ( subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: extractGroupSubFeedbackKeys
values.comment: Extract all unique keys from a list of GroupFeedbacks.
values.type: List (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback) -> List String

values.name: extractGroupSubFeedbackPairs
values.comment: Extract all `(key, feedback')` pairs from a list of GroupFeedbacks.
values.type: List (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback) -> List ( String, subfeedback )

values.name: getGroupCurrentData
values.comment:
Get the current dictionary representing the group's sub-record mapping, without the most recent
deltas factored in.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> Dict.Dict String subtype

values.name: getGroupDataResDeltaList
values.comment: Get the current change in the group's data as a list of (key, (prior, current)) structures.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> List ( String , ( Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v , Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v ) )

values.name: getGroupDataResDeltas
values.comment:
Get the current change in the group's data as a dictionary of resource pairs, each representing
the prior and current values of the data respectively.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> Dict.Dict String ( Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v , Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v )

values.name: getGroupDeltaData
values.comment: Get the current change in the group's data.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> Dict.Dict String (Maybe.Maybe subtype)

values.name: getGroupSub
values.type: String -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> Maybe.Maybe subtype

values.name: getGroupSubData
values.type: String -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v

values.name: getGroupSubFeedback
values.comment: Get the subfeedback in a given GroupFeedback if applicable.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback -> Maybe.Maybe subfeedback

values.name: getGroupSubFeedbackKey
values.comment: Get the key of the subfeedback in a given GroupFeedback if applicable.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback -> Maybe.Maybe String

values.name: getGroupSubFeedbackPair
values.comment: Get the subfeedback and it's associated key `(key, feedback')` in a given GroupFeedback if applicable.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback -> Maybe.Maybe ( String, subfeedback )

values.name: groupAddSub
values.comment:
Add a sub item to the group. This is how you can write new data within a group. One should use
`groupAddSub` to add a new record, then invoke a write operation to add a new item.
values.type: subtype -> String -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype

values.name: groupDataInput
values.comment: Convenience concrete `DB.Data` record group update function accepting a list of `DB.Feedback`.
values.type: List (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback (Pylon.DB.Feedback v)) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v)

values.name: groupDataInputOne
values.comment: Convenience concrete `DB.Data` record group update function accepting one `DB.Feedback`.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback (Pylon.DB.Feedback v) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v)

values.name: groupDataIntegrate
values.comment:
Convenient short version for groups of just data. This equivalency holds:

    groupDataIntegrate controllers =
      groupIntegrate controllers DB.cancel DB.subscribe
values.type: List (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupConfig (Pylon.DB.Feedback v) (Pylon.DB.Binding v) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) , List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )) -> Pylon.DB.Group.GroupConfig (Pylon.DB.Feedback v) (Pylon.DB.Binding v) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) , List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: groupDataResDeltaFoldL
values.comment: Fold from the left across the deltas, using a particular fold function and initial output.
values.type: (String -> ( Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v , Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v ) -> foldout -> foldout) -> foldout -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> foldout

values.name: groupDataResDeltaFoldR
values.comment: Fold from the right across the deltas, using a particular fold function and initial output.
values.type: (String -> ( Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v , Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v ) -> foldout -> foldout) -> foldout -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group (Pylon.DB.Data v) -> foldout

values.name: groupDeriveSub
values.type: (subtype -> derived) -> String -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> Maybe.Maybe derived

values.name: groupDoEachSub
values.comment: Perform groupDoSub at every existing key after deltas.
values.type: (subtype -> ( subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: groupDoSub
values.comment:
Update the data at the given key using an effector, as documented in `Pylon.App`. This can be
used to nest the effectors provided by `Pylon.DB`, or in the case of nested groups, nesting can be
done as many layers deep as needed. _NOTE_ that this is how you can perform concrete operations
`op*` on `DB.DB.Data` records bound recursively within the group.
values.type: (subtype -> ( subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )) -> String -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: groupInput
values.comment: Group feedback update function accepting a list of `DB.Feedback`.
values.type: subtype -> (subfeedback -> subtype -> subtype) -> List (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback) -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype

values.name: groupInputOne
values.comment: Group feedback update function accepting one `DB.Feedback`.
values.type: subtype -> (subfeedback -> subtype -> subtype) -> Pylon.DB.Group.GroupFeedback subfeedback -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype

values.name: groupIntegrate
values.comment:
This is a more configurable version of groupSubscriber. It is now the underlying code for
groupSubscriber. `groupSubscriber` is depreciated in favor of this. The rationale
for this piece is to allow total abstraction of the group source. I ran in to difficulties in
reusing group to mirror changes in local information, such as Mirrors (see DB.Mirror).
values.type: List (Pylon.DB.Group.GroupConfig subfeedback subbinding -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )) -> (subtype -> ( subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )) -> (subbinding -> subtype -> ( subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )) -> Pylon.DB.Group.GroupConfig subfeedback subbinding -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: groupRemoveSub
values.comment:
Remove a sub item from the group. Note that this should very, very rarely ever be called manually
unless the group in question is deliberately not currently bound, in which case this becomes a simple
collection type anyway.
values.type: String -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype

values.name: groupSubscription
values.comment:
Controller for groupIntegrate that carries out the behavior groupSubscriber, which is the most
convenient option for mirroring data from Firebase directly. Since the previous definition was
frustratingly limited to this, I was not able to configure the group to mirror a different source,
such as bindings derived from the data in a mirror.
values.type: ElmFire.Location -> ElmFire.OrderOptions -> Pylon.DB.Group.GroupConfig subfeedback subbinding -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> ( Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: groupUpdateSub
values.comment:
Update the item at the given key using a transformation function. This can be used to nest the
transformations provided by `Pylon.DB`, or in the case of nested groups from this module
(`Pylon.DB.Group`), nesting can be done as many layers deep as needed.
values.type: (subtype -> subtype) -> String -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype

values.name: newGroup
values.comment: A new group item.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype

values.name: resetGroup
values.comment:
Reset a `Group`, such that the next time a `group*Subscriber` is reached, the `Group` will be
rebound to the given `GroupBinding`.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype -> Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype

values.name: voidGroup
values.comment:
A new void group item, which is to say that it starts in the cancelled state, so subscriptions
will have no effect when reached until a call to `resetGroup`.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Group.Group subtype

name: Pylon.DB

aliases.name: Binding
aliases.comment: Data binding. Consists of a `Config`, an address for `Feedback`, and a location in Firebase.
aliases.type: { config : Pylon.DB.Config v , address : Signal.Address (List (Pylon.DB.Feedback v)) , location : ElmFire.Location }

aliases.name: Config
aliases.comment: Data configuration, consisting of a JSON decoder/encoder pair.
aliases.type: { decoder : Json.Decode.Decoder v, encoder : v -> Json.Encode.Value }

aliases.name: DBTask
aliases.comment: An alias for `App.FinalTask`. Kept for legacy reasons in our proprietary codebase.

aliases.name: Data
aliases.comment: Represents a piece of data that may be bound to a Firebase location.
aliases.type: { subscription : Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError ElmFire.Subscription , value : Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v , priorValue : Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v , lastFailed : Maybe.Maybe (Pylon.DB.Operation v) , queue : List (Pylon.DB.Operation v) }

types.name: Operation
types.comment: Opaque type for a database operation.

values.name: bindingFrom
values.comment:
Flipped version of `bindingTo` that composes more naturally in the event that your configuration
was created elsewhere and reused with a new ElmFire location.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Config v -> ElmFire.Location -> Pylon.DB.Binding v

values.name: bindingTo
values.comment: Create a new data binding from a configuration and an ElmFire location.
values.type: ElmFire.Location -> Pylon.DB.Config v -> Pylon.DB.Binding v

values.name: cancel
values.comment:
Cancel your subscription to the data. This puts the data in a void state, so that the
`subscribe` function ceases to have any effect. In order to reactivate the binding, you must
call `reset`. A convenience function `cancelAndReset` is provided, which allows you to skip the
second call if you simply wish to refresh, but not disable, the data binding.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Data v -> ( Pylon.DB.Data v, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: cancelAndReset
values.comment:
A convenience function that cancels any current bindings that might be live, then `reset`s the
structure so that the next time `subscribe` is reached the bindings will be reactivated immediately.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Data v -> ( Pylon.DB.Data v, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: config
values.comment: Declare a data configuration with a decoder/encoder pair.
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder v -> (v -> Json.Encode.Value) -> Pylon.DB.Config v

values.name: configDecoder
values.comment:
Declare a data configuration with a decoder, but a dummy encoder. This is useful when you only
want one way binding from the server, or if you wish to declare the encoder and encoder seperately
for aesthetic reasons.
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder v -> Pylon.DB.Config v

values.name: configEncoder
values.comment: Same as above, but declare only an encoder. Offered for symmetry.
values.type: (v -> Json.Encode.Value) -> Pylon.DB.Config v

values.name: doMap
values.comment: Map the current value of a bound `Data` record _iff_ the value is currently known.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Binding v -> (v -> v) -> Pylon.DB.Data v -> ( Pylon.DB.Data v, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: doOperation
values.comment: Dispatch the given operation immediately on a bound `Data` record.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Binding v -> Pylon.DB.Operation v -> Pylon.DB.Data v -> ( Pylon.DB.Data v, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: doOperationIf
values.comment: Conditionally dispatch an operation on a bound `Data` record.
values.type: (Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v -> Bool) -> Pylon.DB.Binding v -> Pylon.DB.Operation v -> Pylon.DB.Data v -> ( Pylon.DB.Data v, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: doOperationSimple
values.comment: Dispatch the given operation without binding to data.
values.type: ElmFire.Location -> Pylon.DB.Config v -> Pylon.DB.Operation v -> List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never)

values.name: doRetry
values.comment:
Retry the last operation that failed on a given bound `Data` record in the case that any
exists.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Binding v -> Pylon.DB.Data v -> ( Pylon.DB.Data v, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: doTransform
values.comment: Transform the resource within a bound `Data` record. Do not use this unless you absolutely know what you are doing!
values.type: Pylon.DB.Binding v -> (Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v) -> Pylon.DB.Data v -> ( Pylon.DB.Data v, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: enqueueOperation
values.comment: Add an operation to the queue.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Operation v -> Pylon.DB.Data v -> Pylon.DB.Data v

values.name: flushQueue
values.comment: Flush the queue of pending operations, resulting in a list of tasks.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Binding v -> Pylon.DB.Data v -> ( Pylon.DB.Data v, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: forwardingTo
values.comment:
Set the `Feedback` address for a data binding to some forwarding address. Commonly, this is used
to nest `Feedback` within an action type from your application.
values.type: (List (Pylon.DB.Feedback v) -> List action) -> Signal.Address (List action) -> Pylon.DB.Binding v -> Pylon.DB.Binding v

values.name: getLastFailed
values.comment: Get the last operation that failed on the record, if it exists.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Data v -> Maybe.Maybe (Pylon.DB.Operation v)

values.name: getPriorResource
values.comment: Get the prior value of the resource tracked in the `Data` record, as of the last time it changed.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Data v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v

values.name: getResource
values.comment: Get the underlying resource tracked in the `Data` record.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Data v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource Pylon.DB.DBError v

values.name: input
values.comment: Input list update function for `Data`.
values.type: List (Pylon.DB.Feedback v) -> Pylon.DB.Data v -> Pylon.DB.Data v

values.name: inputOne
values.comment: Single input update function for `Data`.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Feedback v -> Pylon.DB.Data v -> Pylon.DB.Data v

values.name: newData
values.comment:
An empty, unbound data. Always initialize instance of Data to this and then invoke `subscribe`
to enable data flow back to the client.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Data v

values.name: nilConfig
values.comment:
A configuration that hasn't yet been filled out. The decoder always fails, and the encoder
always encodes a `null`. Used by `configDecoder` and `configEncoder`.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Config v

values.name: opDelete
values.comment: Delete the bound data.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Operation v

values.name: opPrioritize
values.comment: Give the data a Firebase priority.
values.type: ElmFire.Priority -> Pylon.DB.Operation v

values.name: opSet
values.comment: Set the data to some value.
values.type: v -> Pylon.DB.Operation v

values.name: opSetAndPrioritize
values.comment: Set the data to some value and give it a Firebase priority.
values.type: v -> ElmFire.Priority -> Pylon.DB.Operation v

values.name: opSetOrUpdateChildren
values.comment:
Combination operation that sets the data if the data is known to be void, or else performs the
above listed `opUpdateChildren`.
values.type: v -> Pylon.DB.Operation v

values.name: opUpdateChildren
values.comment:
Update the children in the JSON structure of the data. This diffs the value of the data
currently against the given value after encoding so that a minimal update is always done.

TODO : This may not work right in the event that the data has been updated remotely but not yet
synced to the server. One way around this might be to manually fetch the data first as part of
the operation.
values.type: v -> Pylon.DB.Operation v

values.name: reset
values.comment:
Reset the given data from a void or error state so that the binding can be attempted again the
next time `subscribe` is reached. Notice that this is a simple transformation and not an effector,
so if the data binding is live, this will have no effect. If you wish to cancel an existing
subscription that is live and has not erred, then you should use `cancel`, or `cancelAndReset` in
the case that you wish to rebind the data right away.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Data v -> Pylon.DB.Data v

values.name: sendingTo
values.comment:
Set the `Feedback` address for a data binding. By default, data bindings are bound to a
hidden drain so that you can more comfortably construct bindings without being sure of the target
address right away.
values.type: Signal.Address (List (Pylon.DB.Feedback v)) -> Pylon.DB.Binding v -> Pylon.DB.Binding v

values.name: subscribe
values.comment:
`subscribe` is an effector (see Pylon.App for what what we define an effector to be) that takes
a `Binding` and a `Data`. The resulting tasks when executed will set up 2 way data binding using the
`Config` within the `Binding` to encode and decode the data, and sending all feedback to the
address within the `Binding`.  _Take care to set an address on your `Binding`_, or else the
feedback from the database _will not be recieved by your application._
values.type: Pylon.DB.Binding v -> Pylon.DB.Data v -> ( Pylon.DB.Data v, List (Pylon.DB.DBTask never) )

values.name: voidData
values.comment: A new void data item, which will not be bound by a subscription until it is `reset`.
values.type: Pylon.DB.Data v

values.name: withDecoder
values.comment: Add a decoder to an existing configuration.
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder v -> Pylon.DB.Config v -> Pylon.DB.Config v

values.name: withEncoder
values.comment: Add an encoder to an existing configuration.
values.type: (v -> Json.Encode.Value) -> Pylon.DB.Config v -> Pylon.DB.Config v

name: Pylon.App
comment:
Application module. Similar to StartApp, but with a few extra utilities. Heavily pruned and
simplified with respect to it's predecessor in Scaffold. No longer suffers from heinous type
bloat.


# Configuration And Application Structures

The basic building blocks of the application top level.

@docs Options, Config, Output


# Task Types

@docs Dispatch, ActionTask, FinalTask


# Task List Dispatch Methods

@docs parallel, sequence


# Constructing Options

@docs defaultOptions, optionsDispatchMethod, optionsRunInputsOnStartup


# Configuration DSL

Cumulatively build a configuration using this convenient DSL, starting either from a `nilConfig`
or starting from a `configWithOptions`. The latter can be very nice for flowing right in to building
a configuration from building an `Options` struct.

@docs nilConfig, configWithOptions, configOptions, configInit, configUpdateList, configUpdate, configStage, configPresent, configInput, configListInput, configRawInput

# Chaining Effectors

Effectors are functions which give a pair, the first element of which is the of the same type as the
last argument, and the second element of which is some list of tasks. Chaining is a useful way to
operate on a single model with a sequence of actions, all of which might produce tasks. We use
lists of tasks so that we can elegantly account for the case where no tasks are produced as well as
possibly producing a number of tasks to execute. Such task lists can be either explicitly reduced
by the user using `finalizeTasks`, or they can be converted to `ActionTask`s and returned to the
top level, where the configured `Dispatch` method is used to run the tasks.

@docs chain, chainIf, chainWhile, chainSub, chainSubIf, chainFinalizingEach, asEffector, mappedEffector, noEffect, doEffect, finalizedEffector


# Task Manipulation

Send the results of tasks to addresses, and dispatch them. Use of existing task primitives to handle
situations outside the scope of simply sending/forwarding results to the app's mailbox address and
determining their order of execution is encouraged, so that a repeat of the awful `agent` DSL
from Pylon's predecessor Scaffold is not repeated.

@docs promoteActions, handleErrors, mapErrors, sendActions, forwardActions, sendErrorActions, sendResultActions, finalizeTasks, finalizeTask, thenDo, thenDoNothing


# Running The Application

`run` will allow you to run an application given an initial model and view with a configuration.
`doCycle` exposes the internal functionality used by run, with a little syntactic sugar.

@docs doCycle, run


# Manipulating Sub Models
@docs doSubUpdate, doSubStage, doSubPresent, doSubCycle

aliases.name: ActionTask
aliases.comment: A task which results in a list of actions. This can be routed to an address.

aliases.name: Config
aliases.comment:
Configure an application. Sane defaults are provided so that you can construct as much or as
little as you need using the provided DSL.
aliases.type: { init : Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) ) , inputs : List (Signal.Signal (List actiontype)) , update : List actiontype -> Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) ) , stage : Signal.Address (List actiontype) -> Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) ) , present : Signal.Address (List actiontype) -> Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( Maybe.Maybe viewtype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) ) , options : Pylon.App.Options }

aliases.name: FinalTask
aliases.comment:
FinalTask represents a task whose results have been routed to an address, and is ready to be
executed.

aliases.name: Options
aliases.comment:
Some extra options for apps.

    runInputsOnStartup    -- If this is true, run the actions produced by the initial input signals
                          -- on startup.

    dispatchMethod        -- May either dispatch the top level tasks returned in sequence or in
                          -- parallel.

aliases.name: Output
aliases.comment: Output of the application. Contains the current view, the current model, the current time, and the latest task if it exists.
aliases.type: { view : Signal.Signal viewtype , model : Signal.Signal modeltype , now : Signal.Signal Time.Time , tasks : Signal.Signal (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) }

values.name: asEffector
values.comment:
If you want to take a simple transformation `a -> a` and include it in a chain of
`a -> (a, List (Task z r))`, this is your tool for doing that.
values.type: (modeltype -> modeltype) -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )

values.name: chain
values.comment: Utility function for chaining effectors.
values.type: List (modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )) -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )

values.name: chainFinalizingEach
values.comment:
Chaining effectors, finalizing each resultant task list seperately using the given dispatch
method.
values.type: Pylon.App.Dispatch -> List (modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )) -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )

values.name: chainIf
values.comment: Conditionally chain some effectors.
values.type: (modeltype -> Bool) -> List (modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )) -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )

values.name: chainSub
values.comment:
Chain a list of effectors on a sub model. Provide a fetch and an update function to extract
and replace the sub model, before and after executing the chain of effectors on the sub model
respectively.
values.type: (modeltype -> innertype) -> (innertype -> modeltype -> modeltype) -> List (innertype -> ( innertype, List (Task.Task z r) )) -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )

values.name: chainSubIf
values.comment: Conditionally chain some effectors on an inner model.
values.type: (modeltype -> Bool) -> (modeltype -> innertype) -> (innertype -> modeltype -> modeltype) -> List (innertype -> ( innertype, List (Task.Task z r) )) -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )

values.name: chainWhile
values.comment: Loop a list of effectors until the predicate is no longer satisfied.
values.type: (modeltype -> Bool) -> List (modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )) -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )

values.name: configInit
values.comment: Set an initialization function on the app.
values.type: (Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )) -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype

values.name: configInput
values.comment: Configure an input.
values.type: (inputtype -> actiontype) -> Signal.Signal inputtype -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype

values.name: configListInput
values.comment: Configure a list input.
values.type: (List inputtype -> List actiontype) -> Signal.Signal (List inputtype) -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype

values.name: configOptions
values.comment: Set some extra options on the configuration.
values.type: Pylon.App.Options -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype

values.name: configPresent
values.comment:
Set a presentation function on the app. This can optionally update the view of the application,
or not by returning nothing.
values.type: (Signal.Address (List actiontype) -> Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( Maybe.Maybe viewtype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )) -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype

values.name: configRawInput
values.comment: Configure a raw input.
values.type: Signal.Signal (List actiontype) -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype

values.name: configStage
values.comment:
Set a staging function on the app. Staging is done after all actions are passed through update,
but before presentation.
values.type: (Signal.Address (List actiontype) -> Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )) -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype

values.name: configUpdate
values.comment:
Add a classic single action update function, which is simpler and just as good for most use
cases.
values.type: (actiontype -> Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )) -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype

values.name: configUpdateList
values.comment: Add an update function which is aware of an entire atomic action list as it comes in.
values.type: (List actiontype -> Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )) -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype

values.name: configWithOptions
values.comment: A nil configuration, with the given options set.
values.type: Pylon.App.Options -> Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment: Default options. `runInputsOnStartup` set to `True`.
values.type: Pylon.App.Options

values.name: doCycle
values.comment: Perform a full cycle on a `(model, view)` pair, using the given application configuration.
values.type: Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> Signal.Address (List actiontype) -> List actiontype -> Time.Time -> ( modeltype, viewtype ) -> ( ( modeltype, viewtype ), List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )

values.name: doEffect
values.comment: This gives you a simple way of emitting effects in a chain without changing the model.
values.type: (modeltype -> List (Task.Task z r)) -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )

values.name: doSubCycle
values.comment:
Perform a full cycle with action promotion. Useful for nesting models. This is
deliberately left very unambiguous to avoid obfuscation.
values.type: Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> (List actiontype -> List outeraction) -> Signal.Address (List outeraction) -> List actiontype -> Time.Time -> ( modeltype, viewtype ) -> ( ( modeltype, viewtype ), List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )

values.name: doSubPresent
values.comment: Present a sub model.
values.type: Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> (List actiontype -> List outeraction) -> Signal.Address (List outeraction) -> Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( Maybe.Maybe viewtype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )

values.name: doSubStage
values.comment: Stage a sub model.
values.type: Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> (List actiontype -> List outeraction) -> Signal.Address (List outeraction) -> Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )

values.name: doSubUpdate
values.comment: Update a sub model.
values.type: Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> (List actiontype -> List outeraction) -> List actiontype -> Time.Time -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )

values.name: finalizeTask
values.comment:
Convert any task in to a `FinalTask`. This does not take a `Dispatch` method, because said
method only makes sense when applied to a list of tasks, not a single task.
values.type: Task.Task e r -> List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never)

values.name: finalizeTasks
values.comment:
Dispatch any arbitrary list of tasks using the given dispatch mode, which may be `parallel` or
`sequence`. Note that for the sake of cleaner typing, the output of this function is a list of
`FinalTask`s, however, this list may only have one member in the case that tasks are being
dispatched, otherwise empty if the input list was empty. This is because finalizing a list of
tasks will collapse it, encoding the manner in which is should execute in the resultant task if
it exists.
values.type: Pylon.App.Dispatch -> List (Task.Task e r) -> List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never)

values.name: finalizedEffector
values.comment: Transform an effector by finalizing it's resulting tasks immediately using the given dispatch method.
values.type: Pylon.App.Dispatch -> (modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )) -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Pylon.App.FinalTask never) )

values.name: forwardActions
values.comment: Forward the list of actions produced on the success of this task to the given address using the given transformation function.
values.type: (List actiontype -> List actiontype') -> Signal.Address (List actiontype') -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype actiontype -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype actiontype'

values.name: handleErrors
values.comment: Transform errors from the given task in to actions.
values.type: (errortype -> List actiontype) -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype actiontype -> Pylon.App.ActionTask z actiontype

values.name: mapErrors
values.comment: Map the errors of a given task to another type of error.
values.type: (errortype -> errortype') -> Task.Task errortype r -> Task.Task errortype' r

values.name: mappedEffector
values.comment:
Transform the task output of an effector. This is useful if an effector works on the right type of model
but needs a shim to fit the correct task type
values.type: (List (Task.Task z r) -> List (Task.Task z' r')) -> (modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )) -> modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z' r') )

values.name: nilConfig
values.comment: Empty configuration, providing all defaults and nil behavior.
values.type: Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype

values.name: noEffect
values.comment:
An effector that does nothing and produces no tasks. Useful as a placeholder when no action
is required.
values.type: modeltype -> ( modeltype, List (Task.Task z r) )

values.name: optionsDispatchMethod
values.comment: Set the dispatch method for the top level ActionTasks returned by application functions.
values.type: Pylon.App.Dispatch -> Pylon.App.Options -> Pylon.App.Options

values.name: optionsRunInputsOnStartup
values.comment: Set whether or not to run options.
values.type: Bool -> Pylon.App.Options -> Pylon.App.Options

values.name: parallel
values.comment: Dispatch tasks in parallel, no ordering is required.
values.type: Pylon.App.Dispatch

values.name: promoteActions
values.comment: Transform the action list type of an `ActionTask`.
values.type: (List actiontype -> List actiontype') -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype actiontype -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype actiontype'

values.name: run
values.comment:
With the given configuration, start the application as in StartApp with the given initial model,
and the given default view.
values.type: Pylon.App.Config never modeltype actiontype viewtype -> modeltype -> viewtype -> Pylon.App.Output never modeltype viewtype

values.name: sendActions
values.comment: Send the list of actions produced on the success of this task to the given address.
values.type: Signal.Address (List actiontype) -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype actiontype -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype actiontype

values.name: sendErrorActions
values.comment: Translate task error to a list of actions and send to the given address.
values.type: (errortype -> List actiontype) -> Signal.Address (List actiontype) -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype actiontype -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype actiontype

values.name: sendResultActions
values.comment: Interpret the result of the task whether success or failure as some list of actions and then send.
values.type: (Result.Result errortype successtype -> List actiontype) -> Signal.Address (List actiontype) -> Task.Task errortype successtype -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype actiontype

values.name: sequence
values.comment: Dispatch tasks in sequence. Tasks will execute strictly in the order provided.
values.type: Pylon.App.Dispatch

values.name: thenDo
values.comment:
Turn any task in to an `ActionTask` by performing the given list of actions upon it's successful
completion. Notably, this may be used to turn an `FinalTask` back in to an action task.
values.type: List actiontype -> Task.Task errortype r -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype actiontype

values.name: thenDoNothing
values.comment:
Turn any task in to an `ActionTask` without actually performing any actions. This is good for
transforming tasks that need to be returned from the top level of the application which have already
been finalized, so the types simply have to match. It should be noted that empty action lists do
not trigger any update, staging, or presentation, and as such a busy loop caused by repeated
dispatchment of empty action tasks will not occur.
values.type: Task.Task errortype r -> Pylon.App.ActionTask errortype a

name: Pylon.Resource

values.name: assumeIf
values.comment:
If the given predicate is satisfied, the result will be known to the the given value, otherwise
the given resource will be given unchanged.
values.type: (Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool) -> v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v

values.name: assumeIfNot
values.comment: Negation of assumeIf.
values.type: (Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool) -> v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v

values.name: assumeInCase
values.comment:
In the case that the provided function returns `Just x`, the resource shall be known as that
value, otherwise the Resource shall remain unchanged.
values.type: (Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Maybe.Maybe v) -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v

values.name: decideBy
values.comment: If the resource is an undecided resource, then the given
values.type: (errortype -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v) -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v

values.name: def
values.type: v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v

values.name: deriveIf
values.comment: If the predicate is true, apply the given transformation to get a new resource.
values.type: (Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v' -> Bool) -> (Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v' -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v') -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v' -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v'

values.name: deriveKnown
values.comment:
If the resource is known, then use the given function to create an entirely new replacement resource,
otherwise carry the state to the new resource. This always transforms the type because no other states
carry the value type.
values.type: (v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v') -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v'

values.name: isAll
values.comment: True if _all_ of the given predicates is True, otherwise False.
values.type: List (Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool) -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: isAny
values.comment: True if _any_ of the given predicates is True, otherwise False.
values.type: List (Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool) -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: isKnown
values.comment: True if the resource is known.
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: isNotKnown
values.comment: False if the resource is known.
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: isNotPending
values.comment: False if the resource is pending.
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: isNotUndecided
values.comment: False if the resource is undecided.
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: isNotUnknown
values.comment: False if the resource is unknown.
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: isNotVoid
values.comment: False if the resource is void.
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: isPending
values.comment: True if the resource is pending.
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: isUndecided
values.comment: True if the resource is undecided.
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: isUnknown
values.comment: True if the resource is unknown.
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: isVoid
values.comment: True if the resource is void.
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Bool

values.name: maybeKnown
values.comment: If a resource is known, then give Just it's value, otherwise Nothing.
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v' -> Maybe.Maybe v'

values.name: maybeOr
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Maybe.Maybe v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v

values.name: otherwise
values.comment:
In the event that the given resource is not a simple `def`, we replace it with a different simple
resource.
values.type: v' -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v' -> v'

values.name: pending
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v

values.name: resultOr
values.type: (errortype -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v) -> Result.Result errortype v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v

values.name: therefore
values.comment:
Given a resource of value type v, create a resource of value type v' by transforming the
known value or group using some function (v -> v'). NOTE that this will create an entirely new
resouce structure, and thus any pending changes will be integrated immediately. If you wish to
preserve deltas for the purpose of mirroring and efficient data flow, then one should be using
deltaTo in order to transform just the changes.
values.type: (v -> v') -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v'

values.name: undecided
values.type: errortype -> Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v

values.name: unknown
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v

values.name: void
values.type: Pylon.Resource.Resource errortype v
